definition: Hook or Hooke (name)/Robert Hooke (1635-1703), brilliant English experimental scientist and inventor
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: This Button Hook makes dressing with one hand easier and quicker.
sentences.chinese: 這使得巴頓胡克敷料用一隻手更加容易和快捷。

sentences.english: Michel: ever hear of tensile strength ? Hooke's law of elasticity?
sentences.chinese: 聽說過抗張強度嗎？胡克彈性定律。

sentences.english: Hooker again, managed to make his way toward the bunker, where Johnson and Dingee were.
sentences.chinese: 胡克再次跑回了約翰遜和迪丹吉掩體。

sentences.english: This meant Lee would have only fourteen thousand men to face General Hooker.
sentences.chinese: 這就意味着李將只有1萬4千人來對付胡克將軍。

sentences.english: We have set up crisis services that we have mobilized to the Sandy Hook firehouse to be of assistance.
sentences.chinese: 我們請桑迪胡克消防站協助組織了危機處理小組。

sentences.english: Stresses can be calculated by use of Hooker's law.
sentences.chinese: 脅強可以利用胡克定律算出。

sentences.english: It obeys Hooke's Law, and it is also nearly massless.
sentences.chinese: 它遵循胡克定律，幾乎是無質量的。

sentences.english: For sure, Hooke's Law is no longer active.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問地，胡克定律不再適用。

sentences.english: Ideal case means Hooke's Law must hold.
sentences.chinese: 理想案例意味着，可以使用胡克定律。

sentences.english: OK, Old Kinderhook, is OK, all correct or all right.
sentences.chinese: 行，舊肯德胡克，是OK，都是正確的或全部的權利。

sentences.english: Johnson used some of the shirt pieces to dress Hooker's wounds.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜用了一些襯衫碎條爲胡克包紮了傷口。

sentences.english: He sat down on a large mushroom, and now there was a quiver in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 胡克在一隻大蘑菇上坐下來，他的聲音有點顫抖。

sentences.english: School district officials at Sandy Hook Elementary School say the shooting occurred this morning.
sentences.chinese: 桑迪胡克小學的校區官員表示，今早發生槍殺案。

sentences.english: The wave equations of plane wave in elastic solids are derived from Hooke law.
sentences.chinese: 由胡克定律直接得到彈性體內平面波波動方程。

definition: Edwin Hubble (1889-1953), US astronomer/Fritz Haber (1868-1934), German chemist
Newton (name)/Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Niels Henrik Abel (1802-1829), Norwegian mathematician/(math.) abelian
Werther, opera by Jules Massenet/Werther, German masculine given name
Huygens (name)/Christiaan Huygens (1629-1695), Dutch mathematician and astronomer
